Description: Fragment of tridacna shell carved on the convex wall with rayed semi-circle and linear designs, possibly part of feathers from a wing.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, surface of the ground
Curator's comments: See W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 72 § 68: "A piece of engraved Tridacna, like those found at Naukratis, was also picked up on the surface". The fragment is discussed by R.A. Stucky, The Engraved Tridacna Shells (Dédalo 19; São Paulo, 1974) p. 32-33, no. 27, pl. XVIII.27.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 72 § 68)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.42, p.52, p.173, pl.15)
